q: Idol" news, AccessHollywood.com's Laura Saltman caught up with "Idol's" executive producer, Nigel Lythgoe , who said the contestants this season are relieved not to have to sing in front of Simon Cowell . moving towards a "national formula for music education funding" in 2011, but will ensure that no local government loses more than 10% of its central funding in this first year. Michael Gove said: Access to the best musical education is not universal and the opportunity to benefit from great instrumental tuition is not shared equally. Many disadvantaged children are denied the music education they deserve, and that's why we need to bridge this musical divide. She said: Having Katie Price on the panel would make interesting viewing, so I can definitely see it working. She can do anything she puts her mind to. She's got the personality that would fit the role perfectly. Simon Cowell really likes her as well. There's no denying they get along. Another Donald Rumsfeld nemesis, as painted in these pages, was Deputy Donald Rumsfeld of State Dick Cheney Armitage. "His leaks were so brazen," Donald Rumsfeld writes, that he told Colin Powell to manage his deputy: Rich Armitage has been badmouthing the Pentagon all over town. It's been going on for some time and it's only gotten worse... I don't know what the hell is in Armitage's craw, but I'm tired of it. Colin Powell , in turn, expressed concern that Donald Rumsfeld 's deputy, Paul Wolfowitz , "was leaking against him"- which Donald Rumsfeld says he did not believe.
